data.prayer: Jesus, please send your Spirit to Meru, so they can have freedom.
data.verse: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Meru, Kenya
data.section_summary: What needs would people have here?

data.prayer: Spirit, help the fearful in Meru, Kenya to submit to God and resist the devil.
data.verse: Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 2 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Father, guide the church in Meru, Kenya to see their community as a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

data.prayer: Lord, use Google search to lead people in Meru, Kenya to the gospel today.

Lord, bring the blind by a way that they don’t know. Lead the Sindhi people in paths that they don’t know. Make darkness light before them and crooked places straight. Do not forsake the Sindhi people.
Jesus, raise up prophets and truth speakers in your church in Meru, Kenya so that the church can grow in every way into the mature body of you its head.
data.verse: Instead, speaking the truth in love, we will grow to become in every respect the mature body of him who is the head, that is, Christ.

data.prayer: Father, we pray the believers are good spiritual stewards of their everyday relationships in Meru, Kenya.
Jesus, purify the 672,782 believers in the state of Meru to not just be hearers, but doers of your Word.
data.verse: Blessed is the one who reads aloud the words of this prophecy, and blessed are those who hear it and take to heart what is written in it, because the time is near.

location.name: Meru
location.people_groups_list: Arab, Hadrami, Gujarati, Aweer, Marathi, Punjabi
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Arab, Hadrami (13,000), Gujarati (212,000), Aweer (9,900), Marathi (500), Punjabi (67,000)
